1. INTRODUCTION
1. INTRODUCTION

1. INTRODUCTION
MESSAGE FROM THE MANAGEMENT

1. INTRODUCTION
Dear All,

1. INTRODUCTION
On behalf of Nexcel Solutions Company, I would like to express our warmest welcome to you.

1. INTRODUCTION
Nexcel engages in software development and procurement of software services to Internet-based companies. We issue and grant licenses to its customers to enable the latter to use the Nexcel Platform which contains superior services and features specifically designed to meet the operational needs of its customers.

1. INTRODUCTION
Our responsibility is to provide efficient services to the customers. As a member of the team, you have your part to play in making every client feel welcome to utilize our services.

1. INTRODUCTION
We believe that investing in competent and highly trained individuals is the key to producing high-quality software and outstanding technical and software services. The success of Nexcel in marketing its products and services to Internet-based companies depends on the people attending to Nexcel’s daily operations, from its General Director to its software developers. Nexcel considers its people as one in accomplishing its corporate mission.

1. INTRODUCTION
Your first and primary role, no matter what task you are doing, is to ensure our customers are happy and satisfied and most importantly, we would like you to feel that you work with us and not for us. Every person is a very important link in the chain of operations; no matter what task you are doing, everybody is equally needed. If you enjoy your work and get on well with each other, you can create a happy atmosphere that will reflect on our customers.

1. INTRODUCTION
This Handbook is designed especially for you. It explains Nexcel facilities and guidelines for your daily work. If there is anything else you need to know, please do not hesitate to ask HR-Admin Department. From time to time, revised versions of thishandbook may be given and issued to you.

1. INTRODUCTION
We look forward to a long and mutual working relationship with you.

1. INTRODUCTION
Pham Nguyen Thanh Thien

1. INTRODUCTION
General Director

2.1. Probation

2. TERMS AND CONDITIONS > 2.1. Probation
The probationary period may not exceed the following limits:

2. TERMS AND CONDITIONS > 2.1. Probation
* 60 days for works requiring a college-level qualification or above.

2. TERMS AND CONDITIONS > 2.1. Probation
* 30 days maximum for employment requiring vocational intermediate and professional intermediate level qualifications and technical and professional workers.

2. TERMS AND CONDITIONS > 2.1. Probation
* Not exceeding 6 days for general workers.

2. TERMS AND CONDITIONS > 2.2. Confirmation

One week before the end of the employee’s probation, a Performance Appraisal (PA) form will be automatically sent out for evaluation.

2. TERMS AND CONDITIONS > 2.2. Confirmation
Upon successful completion of their probationary period, employees will sign a labor contract with the Company.

2. TERMS AND CONDITIONS > 2.2. Confirmation

This limitation is not applied to manager level.

2. TERMS AND CONDITIONS > 2.7. Abuse of working time
2.7. Abuse of working time

2. TERMS AND CONDITIONS > 2.7. Abuse of working time
Employees are not allowed to abuse working hours. Scenarios that would be considered abusing working hours may include but are not limited to:

2. TERMS AND CONDITIONS > 2.7. Abuse of working time
* Alter the work schedule (e.g. extending the 1-hour lunch break, going out or going to pantry to have breakfast after Check in, or staying longer in pantry/smoking area for chatting, etc.). Please be reminded that drinks and fast food are offered to help you get more energy for working, not for exploiting duty time.

2. TERMS AND CONDITIONS > 2.7. Abuse of working time
* Check out after playing sport. You must check out first and then enjoy sports, clubs, etc.

2. TERMS AND CONDITIONS > 2.8. Employment termination
2.8. Employment termination

2. TERMS AND CONDITIONS > 2.8. Employment termination > ### 2.8.1. During probation
### 2.8.1. During probation

2. TERMS AND CONDITIONS > 2.8. Employment termination > ### 2.8.1. During probation
During probation period, either Employee or Employer may terminate the employment relationship without notice or compensation.

2. TERMS AND CONDITIONS > 2.8. Employment termination > ### 2.8.2. Upon confirmation
### 2.8.2. Upon confirmation

2. TERMS AND CONDITIONS > 2.8. Employment termination > ### 2.8.2. Upon confirmation
Upon confirmation, employee may unilaterally terminate the labor contract by giving 30 days’ notice for a definite-term contract and 45 days’ notice for an indefinite-term contract.

2. TERMS AND CONDITIONS > 2.8. Employment termination > ### 2.8.3. Procedure
### 2.8.3. Procedure

2. TERMS AND CONDITIONS > 2.8. Employment termination > ### 2.8.3. Procedure
The employee has to submit a written letter of resignation to the General Director, the HR-Admin Manager, and the direct leader and supervisor.

2. TERMS AND CONDITIONS > 2.8. Employment termination > ### 2.8.3. Procedure
If the employee fails to give the required notice, the Company at its discretion has the right to withhold or deduct the employee’s salary in lieu of notice.

### 3.1.3. Overtime

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.1. Compensation > ### 3.1.3. Overtime
Due to the nature of our business operation, employees may be required to work overtime (OT). OT hours will be paid in accordance with the Vietnam Labor Laws.

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.1. Compensation > ### 3.1.3. Overtime
* OT on working days (Monday to Friday) will be recorded and converted into half day of annual leave for every 4 hours. The incomplete/unconverted OT hours will be cumulative over months and years.

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.1. Compensation > ### 3.1.3. Overtime
* OT on holidays or weekends will be converted into money and added to monthly salary.

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.1. Compensation > ### 3.1.3. Overtime

### 3.1.4. Salary payment

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.1. Compensation > ### 3.1.4. Salary payment
The employee’s monthly salary is calculated at the end of each calendar month and normally be paid through auto-pay transfer by the fifth of the following month into employee’s bank account with the Company appointed bank.

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.1. Compensation > ### 3.1.4. Salary payment
Working days in a month: 22 days for each month

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.1. Compensation > ### 3.1.4. Salary payment
Pay calculation for staff working full month: Basic salary

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.1. Compensation > ### 3.1.4. Salary payment
Staff joining in the middle of month/using unpaid leave day: Basic salary/22 x number of actual working days

### 3.2.1. Promotion

### 3.2.2. Duty meals

Employees are provided with meals, and drinks while on duty. The meals provided shall be breakfast, lunch, and dinner, depending on the employee’s shift. If the company is unable to order meals from a supplier, employees will receive a cash allowance instead.

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.3. Leaves
### 3.2.3. Leaves

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.3. Leaves
☑️Annual Leave

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.3. Leaves
Every employee is entitled to 12 days of annual leave for every 12 months of service (one annual leave day per month). The number of days of annual leave shall be increased according to the length of employment by one additional day for every 5 years of service.

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.3. Leaves
SD staff are granted incentive days according to their service time: 1 incentive day for under 3 years of service; 2 incentive days for 3 years of service and under 5 years of service; 3 incentive days for 5 years of service and above.

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.3. Leaves
At any time within a year, staff is only allowed to utilize 5 months of advanced annual leave (5 days). For example:

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.3. Leaves
– In March: employee can take an up-to 8-day annual leave (3 annual leaves of January, February, and March + 5 advanced annual leaves). If he/she wants to take a longer leave (e.g. 10 days), they will need to submit an 8-day annual leave and an extra 2 days unpaid leave.

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.3. Leaves
Half-day leave: can be submitted on the leave day.

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.3. Leaves
* 1-day leave: must be submitted 1 working day in advance.

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.3. Leaves
* 2-4 days leave: must be submitted 2 working days in advance.

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.3. Leaves
* 5 days leave or more: must be submitted 5 working days in advance and approved by the Management.

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.3. Leaves
* For example: if employee wants to take 3 Annual Leaves from Monday (22/10/2018) until Wednesday (24/10/2018), he/she needs to submit the form on Thursday (18/10/2018) – 2 working days in advance.

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.3. Leaves
* Half-day leave cases:

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.3. Leaves
– If the Check in time is 8:00 or sooner, employee can check out at 12:00.

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.3. Leaves
– All other cases, if the total working hours are less than 4 hours, employee must attend to their duties for at least 3 hours (unpaid break time excluded) – 1 hour will be added to ‘Late in/Early out’ Balance of the employee.

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.3. Leaves
Exception may be accepted in emergency cases.

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.3. Leaves
In order to keep healthy, staff are responsible for submitting their own plan in advance to take all the leaves entitlement of each current year by December 31 of that year. Because of this request, staff are not allowed to bring any leaves entitlement in the said year to the next year. Exceptions may be considered case by case. Employees working in Pantry will be paid 100% for all unused leaves if they do not want to use those leaves.

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.3. Leaves
Annual leave cannot be used as a substitute for resignation notice, unless with approval from Management. Employees who resigned after confirmation of employment shall have payment in lieu on a pro-rata basis.

### 3.2.4. Transport allowance

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.4. Transport allowance
Employees are entitled to a monthly transportation allowance of VND 150,000. If he/she just works some days in a month, he/she will be paid on a pro-rata basis.

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.4. Transport allowance

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.5. Work from home
### 3.2.5. Work from home

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.5. Work from home
This work-from-home policy provides guidelines for employees who cannot go to the office due to an incident or unforeseen circumstances. Employees may request to work from home, subject to management approval on a case-by-case basis.

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.5. Work from home
a. Eligibility

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.5. Work from home
Employees who are capable of fulfilling their job responsibilities from home may be eligible for a work-from-home arrangement in cases of personal illness, and quarantine.

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.5. Work from home
b. Approval Process

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.5. Work from home
The work-from-home approval process consists of four steps:

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.5. Work from home
Step 1: Request work-from-home (Employee)

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.5. Work from home
Employees who want to work from home must send an email to their direct supervisor requesting a work-from-home arrangement.

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.5. Work from home
The email should include the following information:

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.5. Work from home
The reason for the work-from-home arrangement.

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.5. Work from home
* The desired duration of the arrangement (in days or weeks).

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.5. Work from home
* Supporting medical records (such as a doctor’s note from a licensed medical professional) must clearly state the employee’s diagnosis and the time duration for limiting physical activity.

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.5. Work from home
For example, a doctor’s note for a sprained ankle must specify that the employee needs to limit the physical activity, mobility for 7-10 days.

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.5. Work from home
Step 2: Evaluate and forward request (Supervisor)

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.5. Work from home
Supervisors will evaluate the request and forward it to management together with medical records for final approval. They will also copy it to the HR department.

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.5. Work from home
Step 3: Review and approve requests (Management)

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.5. Work from home
Management will review and approve work-from-home requests on a case-by-case basis, considering the individual circumstances and feasibility of each request. Factors that will be considered include the nature of the work, job responsibilities, team collaboration, and overall business needs.

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.5. Work from home
Step 4: Notify employee of decision (HR Team)

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.5. Work from home
HR team will notify the employee of the decision made by management.

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.5. Work from home
c. Duration of Work From Home

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.5. Work from home
Employees are required to provide an estimated timeframe for working from home, along with supporting medical documentation.

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.5. Work from home
However, management will make a case-by-case decision on the duration of the work-from-home arrangement based on the actual situation and the needs of the employees.

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.5. Work from home
d. Expectations and Deliverables

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.5. Work from home
Employees who work from home are expected to:

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.5. Work from home
Maintain high levels of performance and meet all deadlines.

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.5. Work from home
* Communicate openly and regularly with supervisors and team members to coordinate and collaborate.

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.5. Work from home
* Be available to collaborate with team members during standard work hours.

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.5. Work from home
* Participate in all required online meetings and discussions.

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.5. Work from home
* Take all necessary measures to protect the confidentiality and security of company information.

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.5. Work from home
e. Equipment and Resources

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.5. Work from home
To work effectively from home, employees need the following equipment and resources:

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.5. Work from home
Reliable internet connection.

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.5. Work from home
* Appropriate software

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.5. Work from home
* Adequate hardware.

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.5. Work from home
* Private and distraction-free workplace. (Avoid public places like coffee shops, or internet cafes)

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.5. Work from home
If employees require any additional equipment or resources, they should contact their supervisor or IT department for assistance.

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.5. Work from home
f. Confidentiality and Security

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.5. Work from home
Employees must take all necessary measures to ensure the confidentiality and security of company information when working from home.

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.5. Work from home
These include but are not limited to:

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.5. Work from home
Following the company’s information security policies.

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.5. Work from home
* Using only authorized devices to connect to the company’s VPN.

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.5. Work from home
* Encrypting sensitive data.

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.5. Work from home
* Not sharing information with unauthorized individuals.

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.5. Work from home
* Avoiding public Wi-Fi networks.

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.5. Work from home
g. Termination of Work From Home Arrangement

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.5. Work from home
Management reserves the right to terminate an employee’s work-from-home arrangement for any but not limited to the following reasons:

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.5. Work from home
* Job performance issues.

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.5. Work from home
* Business needs.

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.5. Work from home
* Changes in job role responsibilities.

3. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS > 3.2. Benefits > ### 3.2.5. Work from home
If an employee’s work-from-home arrangement is terminated, the employee will be given notice and support for transitioning back to the office. This may include reintegration support, workspace assignment, and equipment provision.

content:

The nature of our business demands the highest standards of honesty and integrity from our staff, both while working and outside working hours. Activities that result in adverse publicity for the Company or cause a loss of confidence in the employee’s honesty and integrity can give grounds for dismissal with notice, if appropriate.

headers: 6. CODE OF CONDUCT AND DISCIPLINARY PROCEDURES
content:
6. CODE OF CONDUCT AND DISCIPLINARY PROCEDURES > 6.4. Company rules and regulations
The strict requirements of our industry, including those, that are laid down by law, are such that the Company has to impose certain standards on all staff to protect its business and the jobs of all staff. Breach of these rules, which are also designed for the best interest of our staff, will lead to dismissal without warning or notice.

7. DISCIPLINARY PROCEDURES
7. DISCIPLINARY PROCEDURES

7. DISCIPLINARY PROCEDURES
No disciplinary action will be taken against an employee until the case has been investigated and the facts established. In certain cases in serious matters where serious allegations have been made, including cases of gross misconduct, a precautionary suspension may be imposed pending an investigation and hearing.

7. DISCIPLINARY PROCEDURES > 7.1. Formal oral warning
7.1. Formal oral warning

7. DISCIPLINARY PROCEDURES > 7.1. Formal oral warning
Employees will receive a verbal warning from their immediate supervisor, with a copy sent to the HR Admin Department for filing, if they commit any offenses listed in Section 6.4.3 for the first time (not serious).

7. DISCIPLINARY PROCEDURES > 7.2. Written warning
7.2. Written warning

7. DISCIPLINARY PROCEDURES > 7.2. Written warning
Within 30 days from the date of receiving an oral warning, in case the expected level of improvement has not been attained, or in cases of recurring offenses or the occurrence of a more significant offense, it may be necessary to issue a written warning to the employee.

7. DISCIPLINARY PROCEDURES > 7.2. Written warning
A written warning is also given to the employee who commits the following offenses listed in Section 6.4.2:

7. DISCIPLINARY PROCEDURES > 7.2. Written warning
* Abuse of position

7. DISCIPLINARY PROCEDURES > 7.3. Prolong the time for promotion
7.3. Prolong the time for promotion

7. DISCIPLINARY PROCEDURES > 7.3. Prolong the time for promotion
Extend the duration of promotion or transfer to a lower-paying position for a period not exceeding six months.

7. DISCIPLINARY PROCEDURES > 7.3. Prolong the time for promotion
In cases where an employee’s conduct or performance fails to reach a satisfactory standard at any time within 3 months of receiving the written warning, this disciplinary action will be applied to the employee after a disciplinary hearing.

7. DISCIPLINARY PROCEDURES > 7.3. Prolong the time for promotion
This measure shall also be implemented upon the employee who commits offenses that do not cause serious consequences.

7. DISCIPLINARY PROCEDURES > 7.4. Dismissal
7.4. Dismissal

7. DISCIPLINARY PROCEDURES > 7.4. Dismissal
This action will be applied for the following circumstances:

7. DISCIPLINARY PROCEDURES > 7.4. Dismissal
The offences based on the Vietnam Labor Code

7. DISCIPLINARY PROCEDURES > 7.4. Dismissal
* The employee who had been disciplined at clause 7.3 but still repeated the offense while the discipline measure has not been repealed.

7. DISCIPLINARY PROCEDURES > 7.4. Dismissal
* The employee violates the remaining offenses listed in Section 6.4.2:

1. Introduction

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.1. Purpose
### 1.1. Purpose

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.1. Purpose
Nexcel Career Development Handbook is the document that presents the guidelines, regulations, and procedures for advancing and promoting Nexcel employee’s career paths. The overall purpose of the career advancement/promotion process is to reward and invest in well-performed employees, and motivate them to improve their performance.

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.2. Nexcel Career Paths
### 1.2. Nexcel Career Paths

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.2. Nexcel Career Paths
Nexcel Career Paths encompass various progressions of all Nexcel’s occupations, ranked in a progressive order based on the level of qualifications, skills, and contributions, with two different classifications including Professional and Management Branches.

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.2. Nexcel Career Paths
Our career paths aim to assist employees in identifying their current positions within Nexcel, and provide employees with a better understanding of what knowledge, skills, and qualifications (based on Evaluation Criteria) required to advance to the next title, along with helping them determine their career goals and which career trajectory (Professional or Management Branch) to pursue.

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.2. Nexcel Career Paths
With clearly defined career paths in place, employees will be exposed to more opportunities for promotion as well as expanding their career choices and orientations.

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.2. Nexcel Career Paths
To ensure fair and consistent evaluation of employee’s capability, Nexcel employs job grading system as a standardized approach of objectively assigning value to employee’s positions within the organization. The grading system will also serve as a reference for employee’s career paths in Nexcel.

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.2. Nexcel Career Paths > 1.2.1. Job Titles & Grades
1.2.1. Job Titles & Grades

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.2. Nexcel Career Paths > 1.2.1. Job Titles & Grades
Job titles (Engineer, Senior, Staff, etc.) reflect the experience, qualifications, skills, and knowledge that are necessary to perform the job, along with the contributions accumulated throughout an employee’s entire career development process at Nexcel.

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.2. Nexcel Career Paths > 1.2.1. Job Titles & Grades
To make employees’ career paths more specific, measurable, and achievable, the career goals (qualifications, skills, duties, etc.) for some job titles are broken down into more actionable sub-goals, with each represented by the respective job grades.

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.2. Nexcel Career Paths > 1.2.1. Job Titles & Grades
For some job titles, there are several job grades (A, B, C, D, etc.) The number of job grades will vary depending on the job title. There will be exceptions in which certain job titles do not have job grades.

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.2. Nexcel Career Paths > 1.2.1. Job Titles & Grades
Job title and job grade promotion will strictly follow the procedures outlined in Promotion Process.

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.2. Nexcel Career Paths > 1.2.1. Job Titles & Grades
For more details on job titles and grades, refer to sections 1.2.1.1 (Professional Branch) and 1.2.1.2 (Management Branch).

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.2. Nexcel Career Paths > 1.2.1. Job Titles & Grades

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.3. Approval Authority
### 1.3. Approval Authority

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.3. Approval Authority
Approval Authority is the decision-making body that will make the final approval decision of the promotion.

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.3. Approval Authority > 1.3.1. Approval Authority at Professional Branch
1.3.1. Approval Authority at Professional Branch

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.3. Approval Authority > 1.3.1. Approval Authority at Professional Branch
To get promoted, an employee at Professional Branch must be evaluated and approved by Approval Authority. Depending on the current title of the employee, the Approval Authority can be either one of the followings:

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.3. Approval Authority > 1.3.1. Approval Authority at Professional Branch
• Director/Unit Head: the General Director.

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.3. Approval Authority > 1.3.1. Approval Authority at Professional Branch
• Promotion Committee

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.3. Approval Authority > 1.3.1. Approval Authority at Professional Branch
The committee consists of members who have worked closely with the employee whom they are responsible for evaluating. Promotion Committee’s responsibilities are to evaluate an employee’s qualification for promotion.

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.3. Approval Authority > 1.3.1. Approval Authority at Professional Branch
Depending on the employee’s position/title, the committee may consist of Supervisor, Project Manager, Business Analyst, (Assistant/Technical) Manager, External Parties (Stakeholders, Customers, Business Users, etc.), and other related parties.

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.3. Approval Authority > 1.3.1. Approval Authority at Professional Branch
• Top Management consists of Group CEO.

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.4. Promotion Process
### 1.4. Promotion Process

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.4. Promotion Process
Our Promotion Process takes place annually. During this process, Supervisors or Director/Unit Head may consider selecting candidates to move to a higher position that better matches their skills or aspirations.

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.4. Promotion Process > 1.4.1. Professional Branch

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.5. Eligibility for Promotion
### 1.5. Eligibility for Promotion

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.5. Eligibility for Promotion
Eligibilities are established to determine whether an employee meets the minimal conditions to be considered for promotion. Those who are eligible for promotion consideration include:

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.5. Eligibility for Promotion
1. Employees who have successfully passed their probationary period at Nexcel.

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.5. Eligibility for Promotion
2. Employees who have demonstrated a consistent and increasing level of performance and contribution in the most recent period or assessment.

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.5. Eligibility for Promotion
3. Employees who meet the conditions and requirements specific to their roles as outlined in Evaluation Criteria.

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.6. Individual/Committee Responsibilities > 1.6.1. Supervisor’s Responsibilities
### 1.6. Individual/Committee Responsibilities

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.6. Individual/Committee Responsibilities > 1.6.1. Supervisor’s Responsibilities
1.6.1. Supervisor’s Responsibilities

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.6. Individual/Committee Responsibilities > 1.6.1. Supervisor’s Responsibilities
Prepare a list of potential candidates for promotion, and send it to Director/Unit Head no later than December 1st of the year when the promotion takes place.

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.6. Individual/Committee Responsibilities > 1.6.1. Supervisor’s Responsibilities
Meet with the candidates to inform them about the promotion opportunities and discuss their future career goals/aspirations.

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.6. Individual/Committee Responsibilities > 1.6.1. Supervisor’s Responsibilities
Ask the candidates to collect evidentiary materials and to use said materials to prepare for the Promotion Document.

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.6. Individual/Committee Responsibilities > 1.6.1. Supervisor’s Responsibilities
Set a mutually agreeable schedule for completing the Promotion Document.

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.6. Individual/Committee Responsibilities > 1.6.1. Supervisor’s Responsibilities
Verify and ensure the validity of the evidentiary materials provided by the candidates.

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.6. Individual/Committee Responsibilities > 1.6.1. Supervisor’s Responsibilities
Inform the candidates of the final evaluation/approval results.

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.6. Individual/Committee Responsibilities > 1.6.2. Candidate’s Responsibilities
1.6.2. Candidate’s Responsibilities

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.6. Individual/Committee Responsibilities > 1.6.2. Candidate’s Responsibilities
Collect evidentiary materials demonstrating he/she has the adequate level of seniority, qualifications, skills, impact, and performance to take on the added responsibilities, and use said materials to prepare for the Promotion Document.

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.6. Individual/Committee Responsibilities > 1.6.2. Candidate’s Responsibilities
Submit the Promotion Document on the mutually agreeable schedule.

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.6. Individual/Committee Responsibilities > 1.6.3. Promotion Committee’s Responsibilities
1.6.3. Promotion Committee’s Responsibilities

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.6. Individual/Committee Responsibilities > 1.6.3. Promotion Committee’s Responsibilities
The Promotion Committee will assess if the candidate recommended for promotion is qualified and ready to take on the responsibilities of the higher position and will advise the Director/Unit Head accordingly.

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.6. Individual/Committee Responsibilities > 1.6.3. Promotion Committee’s Responsibilities
Members shall observe and validate the abilities and capabilities of the potential candidate based on the evidentiary materials provided and the criteria/attributes listed in Evaluation Criteria, and finalize the evaluation result by filling and completing the Promotion Assessment Form.

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.6. Individual/Committee Responsibilities > 1.6.3. Promotion Committee’s Responsibilities
Members are responsible for ensuring that all decisions are taken in the best interests of the organization and that their role is carried out effectively.

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.6. Individual/Committee Responsibilities > 1.6.3. Promotion Committee’s Responsibilities
Recommend advancement/promotion, or prepare notes/emails detailing reasons for denial and advising ways of improvement should a rejection decision be rendered.

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.6. Individual/Committee Responsibilities > 1.6.3. Promotion Committee’s Responsibilities
Inform the Human Resource Department of the evaluation results.

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.6. Individual/Committee Responsibilities > 1.6.4. Human Resource Department’s Responsibilities
1.6.4. Human Resource Department’s Responsibilities

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.6. Individual/Committee Responsibilities > 1.6.4. Human Resource Department’s Responsibilities
Human Resource Department shall recommend the Promotion Committee to Top Management for approval.

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.6. Individual/Committee Responsibilities > 1.6.4. Human Resource Department’s Responsibilities
Inform the evaluation/approval results to Director/Unit Head or Supervisors.

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.6. Individual/Committee Responsibilities > 1.6.4. Human Resource Department’s Responsibilities
Prepare the new contract appendices and inform the newly promoted employees about the changes in salary and benefits (if any).

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.6. Individual/Committee Responsibilities > 1.6.5. Director/Unit Head’s Responsibilities
1.6.5. Director/Unit Head’s Responsibilities

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.6. Individual/Committee Responsibilities > 1.6.5. Director/Unit Head’s Responsibilities
Evaluate and approve of the candidates list provided by Supervisors.

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.6. Individual/Committee Responsibilities > 1.6.5. Director/Unit Head’s Responsibilities
Select candidates for Management Branch promotion.

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.6. Individual/Committee Responsibilities > 1.6.5. Director/Unit Head’s Responsibilities
Send candidates list and promotion request to Promotion Committee or Top Management.

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 1. Introduction > ### 1.6. Individual/Committee Responsibilities > 1.6.5. Director/Unit Head’s Responsibilities
Assess the listed candidates (at Assistant Engineer and Engineer levels) and make the final approval decision.

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 2. Evaluation Criteria
2. Evaluation Criteria

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 2. Evaluation Criteria
Evaluation Criteria is a set of standardized requirements to assess whether an employee is capable of performing the responsibilities associated with the title that they are being promoted. An employee must meet and fulfill the required criteria to be considered for promotion. Evaluation Criteria is classified into the following categories:

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 2. Evaluation Criteria
• Quality of Work/Achievements

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 2. Evaluation Criteria
The significant achievements/contributions that an employee has accomplished, or the required quality of work that an employee has maintained over an extended period.

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 2. Evaluation Criteria
• Qualifications and Skills

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 2. Evaluation Criteria
Qualifications and skills that an employee has acquired to better match the requirement of the new level of the position.

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 2. Evaluation Criteria
• Accretion of Duties

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 2. Evaluation Criteria
New responsibilities resulted from the gradual addition of duties that an employee has undertaken from time to time to be qualified for the new level of the position.

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 2. Evaluation Criteria
• Years of Experience

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 2. Evaluation Criteria
o Professional Experience – years of experience an employee has accumulated in a particular position throughout their entire career.

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 2. Evaluation Criteria
o Experience in Nexcel – years of experience an employee has gained by working at Nexcel.

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 2. Evaluation Criteria
• English Proficiency

Nexcel Career Development Handbook > 2. Evaluation Criteria
English Proficiency is measured by how much an employee scored in the TOEIC Listening and Reading Test, the score will differ depending on the title.
